pull.title: [Qt] show number of in/out connections in GUI debug console
pull.body: I found it usefull to directly see the numbers, no need to go over `getpeerinfo`...

events.body: I agree that this information is useful to have in the debug window.
by debug you mean --printtoconsole ? I agree, if thats the case.
@int03h Sorry no, this is for the GUI debug console.

@laanwj How can I handle `connect(model, SIGNAL(numConnectionsChanged(int)), this, SLOT(setNumConnections(int)));`, when `setNumConnections()``no takes 2 ints (in and out)? I don't want to rewrite or add net (core) code for this.

Perhaps just take `numConnectionsChanged()` as a trigger to query in/out?

Oh crap the setNumConnections comes from core core? Of course. Ok, in that case, let's just keep it like this.
Please ignore my suggestions except for the int ClientModel::getNumConnections(bitfield enum) one. Would be nice to have one function to get number of connections, not a bunch.
@laanwj Can you take another look please.
Updated and shortened code a lot.
Haven't tested, but agree that showing in/out connections is a good fit there.

issue.title: qt: Deduplicate NumConnections enum
issue.body:
There are two identical `NumConnections` enums in the code base:
- `enum NumConnections` in `qt/clientmodel.h` was introduced in #3685
- `enum CConnman::NumConnections` in `net.h` was introduced in #8085

This PR drops the former enum in favor of the latter one.

comments.body:
I'd suggest getNumConnections(bool includeInbound=true, bool includeOutbound=true) (edit)
Or alternatively define some w/ enumeration bitfield IN OUT INOUT.
